resources.string: Before the first use, please read the info about the program. This description will be available later in the menu.

This application is designed for monitoring Arduino signals. Before using it, please read the following description: \n First, connect your Arduino to your device via an OTG cable. After granting the permission, the application starts. First, select the appropriate baud rate from the menu. The default is 115200. You can also adjust the appearance of the graph in the menu. For monitoring purposes, you must first specify the transmit frequency in Hz. You can then connect to Arduino using the CONNECT button. The START/STOP MONITORING button is used to start or stop monitoring the signals. The save and load functions can only be used when the signals are not being monitored. Before loading, you may want to look at formatting a saved file. The application can only read files formatted in this way with as data.txt. The path is displayed when you save.
Channel 1 X:, Channel 1 Y:, Channel 2 X:, Channel 2 Y:, Channel 3 X:, Channel 3 Y:
